Systemic lupus erythematosus , SLE , is an autoimmune disease that debilitates as many as 1.5 million Americans â€ mostly women who are in their fertile years .
Some scientists believe that epigenetic modulators , often used in the treatment of lymphomas , could be useful therapies for lupus as well .
These findings provide a scientific rationale for why epigenetic modulators might be effective in humans .
The Alliance for Lupus Research grant will identify novel targets for new lupus therapeutics .
